articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Congratulates New President of Myanmar
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Congratulates New President of Myanmar
 Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a congratulatory message to Thein Sein upon his election as president of Myanmar.
					 Expressing belief that the good relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to favorably develop in the future, too, the message wished him big success in his work.

articles.title: US "Engagement" Policy Slashed--Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
US "Engagement" Policy Slashed--Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun, a major newspaper of the DPRK, terms "engagement" advocated by the U.S. a synonym for aggression, war and interference. 
					 In a bylined article on Sunday, the newspaper says:
					
					 The "engagement" policy, one of the methods employed by the U.S. authorities, reveals their intention to control all other countries and regions and make the world move under the U.S. direction by interfering in their matters. 
					
					 Under the veil of "engagement" the U.S. has interfered in the internal affairs of other countries politically and militarily.
					
					 The U.S. authorities criticize other political modes different from the U.S. and western-style ones as "wrong", asserting that they should follow the U.S.-style political system through their "political reforms." This is intended to convert other countries' political system and life into the American way.
					
					 The U.S. call for "enlarged multilateral engagement" with Asian countries comes out of its cunning trick to put them under its control by escalating its "engagement" in their various matters arising in the political field.
					
					 The U.S. has enforced the military intervention policy under the pretext of "regional security" and "control over dispute", whenever unexpected armed disputes and disorder happened in different regions and countries. Prompted by such way of thinking and stand, the U.S. is pursuing the military "engagement" policy aimed at maintaining its superiority over strength in various regions of the world and expanding its power sphere.
					
					 This military "engagement" policy of the U.S. is getting evermore pronounced in Northeast Asia and especially the Korean Peninsula at present. This policy is mainly aimed to stifle the DPRK and realize the U.S. rule over the whole area of Korea. The situation of the peninsula is becoming more strained and practical danger is growing serious due to the U.S. whereby another Korean war may break out at any moment.

articles.title: Japan-S. Korea Military Talks Criticized
articles.content:
Japan-S. Korea Military Talks Criticized
 Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- Japan's defence minister recently had talks with his south Korean counterpart, in which they agreed to hold defence ministerial and vice-ministerial talks in turn once in a year. This means that Japan will start a new dangerous military collusion with south Korea, says Rodong Sinmun, a major newspaper of the DPRK, in a bylined article on Sunday.
					 The Japanese militarist forces' escalated scheme for a military agreement with south Korea shows that they are impudently running towards reinvasion as they have become puffed by the moves for turning Japan into a military giant, the article points out.
					
					 It further says:
					
					 Japan's military confab with south Korea is intended to speed up the moves to build a U.S.-Japan-south Korea military alliance.
					
					 The Japanese militarist forces have designated the DPRK as the first target of their reinvasion of Asia. They are running wild to realize their ambition for staging a comeback to Korea, riding on the war chariot of their U.S. master.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will never pardon those forces who committed indelible war crimes against the Korean nation in the past and frantically seek to set out on the road of reinvasion again under the U.S. umbrella of war in the new century.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' moves for reinvasion of Korea are as good as inviting their own destruction. They should squarely see the pent-up hostility of the Korean army and people toward Japan and stop at once the criminal scheme for triangular military alliance and reinvasion of Korea through establishment of military alliance with south Korea.

articles.title: Abolition of NSL Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Abolition of NSL Demanded in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- The Teachers Union in south Korea issued a statement urging the abrogation of the "National Security Law", an evil law against reunification and democracy, on Tuesday. 
					 The statement noted that Choe Po Gyong, a teacher residing in South Kyongsang Province, was declared not guilty that day after being tried for three years on suspicion of violation of the NSL.
					
					 Choe had conducted education activities with grief at the division of the nation as well as desire for the students in the north and the south to lead a peaceful life in a reunified country, the statement said, adding: But the police and the prosecution searched Choe's house and office in February 2008 and took a legal action against this teacher by invoking the fascist law in August that year. 
					
					 It demanded that the authorities stop their anachronistic crackdown on teachers' just education activities and reunification movement and abolish the NSL.

articles.title: Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Feats Held in Mexico
articles.content:
Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Feats Held in Mexico
 Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- A joint seminar on the theme of "Immortal Exploits of Comrade Kim Jong Il, Illustrious Commander of Songun" took place in Mexico on January 28 on the occasion of his birthday.
					 Present there were personages of the Mexican National Coordinating Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism and its affiliated organizations and the Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea and adherents of the Juche idea in Mexico.
					
					 Ramon Jimenez Lopez, chairman of the National Coordinating Committee, said that Kim Jong Il performed undying feats by defending the dignity and sovereignty of the country and the nation and putting the DPRK on the position of a politico-ideological, military and scientific and technological power through his energetic ideo-theoretical activities and distinguished Songun leadership.
					
					 His Songun politics serves as an invincible banner and all-purpose sword of the Korean revolution, the chairman said, adding: The world progressives struggling for socialism regard the DPRK as the beacon of hope and extend support and solidarity to the Korean people in the drive to build a thriving nation. 
					
					 Juan Campos Vega, chairman of the Institute, and other speakers praised Kim Jong Il's Songun revolutionary exploits.
					
					 They expressed their will to intensify the study and dissemination of the Juche idea, the Songun idea and thus contribute to significantly commemorating the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung as a holiday common to humankind.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Egypt
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Egypt
						
 Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Our Socialism Centred on the Masses Shall Not Perish" was brought out in booklet on Feb. 1 by the Al-Ahram Commerce Publishing House of Egypt.
					 The work, published on May 5, Juche 80 (1991), clarifies the inevitability of the triumph of socialism, the secret of solidity and invincibility of Korean socialism, its intrinsic characteristics, etc.
